title: Net Promoter Score Process
description: Test is based on the NPS Compendium (1pager) and checks knowledge about Net Promoter Score process: calculating, collection, AARs etc.

published_attributes.title: NPS Process
published_attributes.serialized_body:
Our NPS Process test is based on the NPS 1-pager. To pass the test please familiarise yourself with the Confluence page linked below.

NPS Compendium (1pager)

In order to pass the test you will need to provide at least 80% of correct answers. You can have unlimited attempts to pass the test. When you're ready to take the test click the "Continue button" below.

Good luck!

answers.body: via the NPS survey only
on a call only
the rule is to collect it on a call. If it‚Äôs not possible then we should send the client the NPS survey

published_attributes.title: How should the NPS be collected?

answers.body: via the NPS survey only
on a call only
the rule is to collect it on a call. If it‚Äôs not possible then we should send the client the NPS survey

draft_attributes.title: How should the NPS be collected?

answers.body: every month
We collect the first NPS no later than 30 days after kickoff. Next, no later than every 90 days
every 6 months
every quarter for existing and new projects

published_attributes.title: How often NPS is collected in general?

answers.body: every month
We collect the first NPS no later than 30 days after kickoff. Next, no later than every 90 days
every 6 months
every quarter for existing and new projects

answers.body: NPS = (%)Promoters - (%)Detractors

draft_attributes.title: Choose the correct description of the NPS lights:

answers.body: The project has marked the ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt collect NPS‚Äô checkbox.
It means the project is no longer included in the NPS calculations. Finished projects fall into the ‚ÄòArchived‚Äô group after 90 days the project ends (last active assignment‚Äôs end date)
NPS collection for this project is overdue
It tells us that the project‚Äôs a ‚Äòmaintenance only‚Äô project

published_attributes.title: What does üñ® :archive: icon (NPS light) say to us?

answers.body: The project has marked the ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt collect NPS‚Äô checkbox.
It means the project is no longer included in the NPS calculations. Finished projects fall into the ‚ÄòArchived‚Äô group after 90 days the project ends (last active assignment‚Äôs end date)
NPS collection for this project is overdue
It tells us that the project‚Äôs a ‚Äòmaintenance only‚Äô project

answers.body: that often as we collect it on any other regular project - every 90 days from the last nps collection
up to 12 months since the last nps collection
up to 6 months since the last nps collection
‚ÄòMaintenance only‚Äô projects are excluded from the nps collection

published_attributes.title: How often do we collect NPS for ‚Äòmaintenance only‚Äô projects?

answers.body: that often as we collect it on any other regular project - every 90 days from the last nps collection
up to 12 months since the last nps collection
up to 6 months since the last nps collection
‚ÄòMaintenance only‚Äô projects are excluded from the nps collection

draft_attributes.title: How often do we collect NPS for ‚Äòmaintenance only‚Äô projects?

answers.body: Projects that should be excluded from collection and calculation are marked with a ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt collect NPS‚Äô checkbox. You need to ask for the account's SDM approval.
There is no option to do that.
By putting a request on #nps channel and mentioning nps team and giving the case details. Only the NPS team can exclude given projects from the NPS collection if needed.
To remove a project from the collection and calculation the AM needs to ask the Leader for an approval and then log an NPS with a neutral score and reasoning why the nps wasn‚Äôt possible to collect.

published_attributes.title: How to exclude a project from the NPS collection if there are reasons?

answers.body: Projects that should be excluded from collection and calculation are marked with a ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt collect NPS‚Äô checkbox. You need to ask for the account's SDM approval.
There is no option to do that.
By putting a request on #nps channel and mentioning nps team and giving the case details. Only the NPS team can exclude given projects from the NPS collection if needed.
To remove a project from the collection and calculation the AM needs to ask the Leader for an approval and then log an NPS with a neutral score and reasoning why the nps wasn‚Äôt possible to collect.

draft_attributes.title: How to exclude a project from the NPS collection if there are reasons?

answers.body: Notifications with coming scores are displayed on the #nps channel on slack
We collect NPS on a call, if possible. AM and PC/PM Lead are both present on a call
A person logging an NPS into SF, needs to add feedback Tags
I can‚Äôt check what‚Äôs the Company NPS and how recent scores look like, as the NPS reports are accessible only for NPS team and Core members
‚ÄòMaintenance only‚Äô projects are excluded from the NPS collection
Generally, each NPS meeting should end with some Action Plan
